sections.title: Leopard found in Sri Lanka
sections.description: One of the national parks would be the Yala National park. Located in the South East Sri Lanka, Yala is famously known for its most densely populated leopard presence on earth. Theres an estimated 40 Leopards roaming around the Yala National Park.

sections.title: Wilpathu National Park
sections.description: The next national park for sighting Leopards would be the Wilpathu National park. It is known to be the biggest national park in Sri Lanka located in north-west lowlands which once a famous place for seeing Leopards in the country.

sections.title: Udawalawe National Park
sections.description: The last or least of National park would be the Udawalawe National park which is known for a place to elephant and it is 4 hours away from Colombo by a car.

sections.title: Threats faced by Sri Lankan leopard
sections.description: Sri Lankan leopard faces major issues as the human population in Sri Lanka slowly moves towards cultivating farmlands, livestock, and settlements which many years ago belonged to the wildlife.
